Hello!

What I recommend is downloading the largest wallpaper size from the [teaser site (3840x1080)](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/site/skins-lunar-revel-intro/), and putting it in the image editing software of your choice.  

Crop to the aspect ratio of your shadow box, keeping as much of the image as you can.  Sometimes I've added black bars to fill up any excess space, other times I have cropped off non-important parts of the image instead.

The tricky part is getting the image the right size - it all depends on what you set the DPI to.  Some of the more heavyweight image editing programs will actually let you set the exact print size of the image - which would be ideal!  Otherwise you'd need to carefully take the size you want, multiply it by the DPI, and re-size the image to that many pixels.

Good luck and I'd love to see what you come up with!

Awesome!  You've done a great job with that.  Still in one piece?

These things (with the gloss paper and the glass front panel) can be really tricky to photograph (especially in artificial light) so I know your photo pain :)

I can recommend taking a black sharpie pen to the joints of the frame to help hide the gaps at the corners.  I've actually been considering taking a pen to the edges of my paper too, to give it more of a defined edge, but while I'm sure that would work awesome on the Braum/Ryze/Gragas/Varrus campfire scene, I don't know if a black border would be overwhelming for this, lighter colored, scene.  I too have a couple of ragged edges where the white paper shows though, you see.

(And no-one is going to notice your missing trees unless you tell them ;D  I know how damn fiddly they are though!)
